intro: Memecylon lopezianum, commonly known as the Lopez memecylon, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves that are often hairy underneath. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers with four petals, followed by dark blue, spherical berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
